text:
-Now, I want you
to treat other people

like the race that is on
their forehead, okay?

-Welcome to the 8th annual
Dundies Awards.

Before we get started,
a few announcements.

Keep your acceptance
speeches short.

I have "wrap it up" music an
I'm not afraid to use it, Devon.

-That guy, "Mr. Brown", uh
he got us halfway there.
Uh, Devon?
Can I talk to you for a second

-Creed's an idiot,
you know that.

-Well, he --
-No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no,

no, you had it right
the first time.

-Well, maybe I did.
-Exactly.
You gotta go with you gut, man
-[ Sighs ] N-No.
I can't. No!

I can't go back.
I would look like an idiot

-That's why I'm being fired?
-No.

-So you might not
look like an idiot?

-No, it was all the stuff
that I said.

It was the business
downturn and cutbacks

and -- and -- and --
-God, this is unbelievable

-I just hope that you and
can remain friends.
Devon, wait. Please.
Look, look.

In addition to severance
and everything, I want to

give you this gift certificate
to Chili's.
From me.
Okay? No hard feelings.
-Kevin, Jim, Pam, Kelly, Toby,

Oscar, Meredith,
Phyllis, Stanley,

or the temp, if any of you
want to meet me for a drink
I'm gonna be at Poor Richard's
The rest of you can go to hell
[ Door opens ]
[ Door closes ]

-I think I gained a couple
pounds since I got here.

-[ Laughs ]
Oh, you can afford it.

-I brought in some new faces
and one old.
I always liked Devon.

I hired him back after Creed
faked his own death

in the baler the day
after the doc aired.
-Hey, hey, Scott! Hey!
Hey! Hey!

Come here! Get me a hot dog!
Come here!

-You know what? It was nice
to see Devon again,

to sort of get closure
on that whole thing.
